enum.name: LineStyle
enum.comment: Enumeration defining the possible line styles.

enum.name: Anchor
enum.comment: Enumeration defining the possible anchor points. They are used for determining text alignment towards the reference point. The point is at the appropriate position of the bounding box of the text.

data.comment:
This interface provides can be used by graphing applications to provide a graphing service to other components. This is intended to be used for debugging purposes. Usage of the interface should be optional to turn it off during a competition.
Add* messages will add the given object permanently, so the graphical display can be considered as a scenegraph. The message ID is becomes the ID and can be used to delete the object using the DeleteObjectMessage. With the DeleteAll message all objects can be removed (shall only remove objects added by the same sender, thus data drawn by other senders is not touched).
The units shall be in meters and radians. Color is given as four byte RGBA value, one byte for each R, G, B and Alpha.

message.name: AddCartLine
message.comment: Add a line to the display. The line is defined by two points in cartesian coordinates (standard Fawkes coordinate system).

message.name: AddCartCircle
message.comment: Add a circle to the display. The circle is defined by the cartesian coordinates of its center point and its radius.

message.name: AddCartRect
message.comment: Add a rectangle to the display. The rectangle is defined by the cartesian coordinates of its lower right corner and its width and height, therefore growing in accordance with the Fawkes coordinate system
message.field: X coordinate of lower right corner
Y coordinate of lower right corner

message.name: AddCartText
message.comment: Add a text to the display. The text is defined by the cartesian coordinates of its upper left corner.
message.field: X coordinate of upper left corner
Y coordinate of upper left corner
Anchor which marks the alignment to the given point.

message.name: DeleteObject
message.comment: Delete referenced object. Deletion will fail if the object was added by another sender.
message.field: Object ID, which is the message ID of the Add* message.

message.name: DeleteAll
message.comment: Delete all objects added by this sender.
